entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 4:34AM AKST until January 04 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER CONTINUES FOR THE FAR NORTHERN PANHANDLE... Various reports of upwards of 6 to 8 inches snow for the Haines and Chilkat Peninsula area were received around 11 pm Wednesday with snow still falling moderately. Snow rates are starting to lighten this morning around the area as the front starts to move into Canada.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 8:55PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds and Blowing Snow Possible This Weekend... entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 04 at 10:06AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE WINTER/SPRING FLOOD POTENTIAL IS ABOVE NORMAL ACROSS MOST OF SOUTHERN NEW ENGLAND... The winter/spring freshwater flood potential is above normal across most of southern New England, but is near normal on Cape Cod and the Islands. The threat of flooding due to ice jams is below normal for early January.
